name: The Monetary Matters Network
title: Why Hedge Funds Must Adapt or Disappear
text:
Synopsis
Hedge funds with high correlation to market indices and high fees are becoming obsolete, as investors seek more differentiated investment strategies that provide unique portfolio value.

Key Insights
- Many hedge funds currently have 70-80% correlation with the S&P index
- These funds charge relatively high fees despite minimal differentiation
- Institutional allocators already have extensive equity beta exposure
- Existing portfolios typically have investments that perform well in normal markets but underperform during downturns
- The key to improving portfolio performance is not adding more similar assets, but introducing truly distinctive investment implementations
